P1.competency: Evaluates external training vendors and learning resources.

examples.0: Participates in discussion regarding evaluating external training vendors or learning resources with support.
examples.1: Autonomously evaluates external learning offerings and updates the team website to include those resources.
examples.2: Drives the evaluation discussion and conducts audits on resources listed on website to ensure relevance and functionality.
examples.3: Seeks opportunities to share knowledge on how to evaluate external learning offerings through the creation of a evaluation rubric.

P2.competency: Establishes Tech U partnerships to develop learning offerings.

examples.0: Participates in the discussion of developing learning materials and completes assigned action items.
examples.1: Participates and engages in the discussion by making suggestions for team contributions and asking for specific action items.
examples.2: Drives partnership by actively communicating with the team on a roadmap for the project that includes regular updates, roadblocks, and what contributions the rest of the team can make to move execution forward.
examples.3: Seeks opportunities to share knowledge on how to communicate project updates so the team could step in to help at any time. Makes recommendations to leadership on how they or the team can improve collaboration on development projects.

A1.competency: Creates and conducts analysis of learning requests and offers learning development solutions based on the assessment criteria.

examples.0: Attends meetings with requestors and team to document the knowledge, skill, and behavior gaps identified and possible solutions discussed based on the assessment criteria.
examples.1: Participates in discussion and connects requestor with external and internal learning resources and opportunities.
examples.2: Drives discussion while making recommendations to requestor for external and internal learning resources. Actively shares information gathered during iteration planning meetings.
examples.3: Partners with Tech U leadership to align new requests to team and technology goals or initiatives to drive iteration planning meeting discussion and agenda. Seeks opportunities to share knowledge and learn new techniques on conducting analyses with requestors.

A2.competency: Establishes learning outcomes that align with needs analysis results and incorporate Bloom's Taxonomy.

examples.0: Writes learning outcomes that align with the needs analysis and incorporates Bloom's Taxonomy levels one and two, knowledge and comprehension.
examples.1: Write learning outcomes that incorporate levels three and four of Bloom's Taxonomy, application and analysis.
examples.2: Partners with leadership to ensure learning outcomes align with global strategy for technology training to incorporate Bloom's Taxonomy levels five and six, synthesis and evaluation.
examples.3: Seek opportunities to share knowledge and learn new techniques on how to write learning outcomes that align with needs analysis results and incorporate Bloom's Taxonomy.

examples.0: Is aware of instructional design models but needs support on how to use the model as a guide for development of learning materials.
examples.1: Identifies and implements an instructional design model.
examples.2: Identifies and implements an instructional design model based on the instructional method that is applicable to the needs assessment.
examples.3: Seeks opportunities to share knowledge and learn new techniques on how to develop learning materials based on the instructional model recommended.

D2.competency: Creates design guidelines (design document, outline, style guides or standards guidelines) for development projects.

examples.0: Partners with instructional designers to create design guidelines for development projects that includes details such as the audience, learning needs or gaps, instructional methods, learning outcomes, Kirkpatrick evaluation plans, and deliverable timelines.
examples.1: Schedules and drives design guideline meetings to identify and assign tasks iteratively.
examples.2: Communicates project updates iteratively with team and product owners.
examples.3: eeks opportunities to share knowledge on how to develop design guidelines. Also, looks for opportunities to stay up to date and learn new techniques.

examples.0: Incorporates engagement techniques throughout the design of learning materials by incorporating activities, discussion prompts or outlines, videos, media, assessment questions, etc throughout the duration of the learning with reminders or prompting from the team.
examples.1: Incorporates engagement techniques without prompting or reminders from the team.
examples.2: Autonomously incorporates a variety of engagement techniques on a regular cadence for any developed learning based on the duration of the entire learning experience.
examples.3: Seeks opportunities to share knowledge and best practices for engagement while developing learning content. Also, looks for opportunities to stay up to date and apply new techniques for engagement.

V2.competency: Identifies instructional methods (instructor-led, e-learning, documentation, video, job-aid, or learning resource) to fill knowledge, skill, and behavior gaps.

examples.0: Is aware of the instructional methods and is able to apply those to a specific learning request to fill knowledge, skill, or behavior gaps by collaborating with Tech U team members.
examples.1: Able to identify and recommend which instructional methods are required to fill the knowledge, skill, or behavior gap.
examples.2: Able to identify, recommend, and justify which instructional methods are required to fill the knowledge, skill, or behavior gap.
examples.3: Seek opportunities to share knowledge on how to apply instructional methods to fulfill knowledge, skill, and behavior gaps. Also looks for opportunities to innovate the instructional methods used at QL Technology.

V3.competency: Develops learning offerings and materials that align with course learning outcomes and needs analysis.

examples.0: Develops learning offerings and materials that align with learning outcomes and needs analysis data with coaching or support from the team.
examples.1: Autonomously creates learning offerings that align with learning outcomes and needs analysis data.
examples.2: Evaluates Tech U developed learning for alignment to identified learning outcomes and needs analysis results.
examples.3: Seeks opportunities to share knowledge on how to create learning that aligns with outcomes and business needs including how to use the necessary tools. Also, looks for opportunities to stay up to date and learn new techniques.

I1.competency: Develops a plan for the strategic release of new learning opportunities developed by Tech U.

examples.0: Develops a plan for the release and marketing of new learning opportunities to include SPOC requirements, website information, and email templates with support from the team.
examples.1: Develops a plan for the release and marketing of new learning opportunities with no support.
examples.2: Drives discussions with team on how to develop a plan for the strategic release and marketing of new learning opportunities.
examples.3: Coaches team members on how to develop a plan for the strategic release for new learning opportunities. Also, looks for opportunities to stay up to date and learn new techniques.

I2.competency: Creates learning structure and curriculum in SPOC (LMS, LRS, Skillo, Moodle, google classroom, etc.)

examples.0: Creates structure of learning in SPOC for Technology team members to access.
examples.1: Identifies audiences to incorporate into the learning offering to increase awareness around learning required or available to team members.
examples.2: Autonomously creates learning structure for SPOC, audience, and notifications that will send to team members and leaders.
examples.3: Seeks opportunities to share knowledge on how to create structures and curriculums for learning in SPOC. Also, looks for opportunities to stay up to date and learn new techniques.

E1.competency: Maintains existing learning materials to fill assessed retention and learning gaps.

examples.0: Creates a maintenance plan to edit existing learning materials to fill assessed retention and learning gaps with support from the team.
examples.1: Autonomously edits existing learning materials and communicates changes with the team and technology when applicable.
examples.2: Drives team partnership to perform and communicate maintenance to existing learning materials.
examples.3: Seeks opportunities to share knowledge and stay up to date on how to perform maintenance plans on existing learning materials.

E2.competency: Creates evaluation plan throughout development to assess learner retention and learning gaps.

examples.0: Develops learning that incorporates levels one and two of the Kirkpatrick evaluation model with support from the team.
examples.1: Autonomously develops learning that incorporates levels one and two of the Kirkpatrick evaluation model.
examples.2: Drives evaluation discussion during development to incorporate levels one through three of the Kirkpatrick evaluation model.
examples.3: Partners with Tech U leadership to incorporate level four of the Kirkpatrick evaluation model. Seeks opportunities to share knowledge on how to incorporate the Kirkpatrick evaluation model throughout development. Also looks opportunities to stay up to date and learn new techniques.

E3.competency: Collaborates on maintenance for Tech U learning materials.

examples.0: Partners with Learning Consultants to perform maintenance to make learning more effective and verifies alignment with learning outcomes.
examples.1: Autonomously partners with Learning Consultants to support course maintenance.
examples.2: Drives partnership with Instructional Designers and communicates those changes for awareness. Collaborates with Learning Consultants on revamping learning content to verify alignment with learning outcomes. Utilizes business need data to determine cadence and sun setting of offerings.
examples.3: Seeks opportunities to share knowledge on performing maintenance on learning. Also identifies opportunities to develop a maintenance cadence to review learning materials which includes identifying and communicating appropriate changes to make learning more effective.
